title: Pythagorean Legacy
text:
It is necessary to find a minimal integer value R which is equal to the length of the hypotenuse (the side opposite the right angle) of N non-identical rectangular triangles with integer lengths of sides.Inputt - number of test cases [t ≤ 100], then t lines follow, each line contains one integer - N, equal 
to the required number of different rectangular triangles. [1 ≤ N ≤ 2000]OutputFor each test case your program should output a number R in a separate line (R fits in a 64-bit integer), equal to the minimal integer value of a hypotenuse for which exactly N different rectangular triangles can be constructed; then in separate lines follow exactly N numbers equal to the shorter 
cathetus (side adjacent to the right angle) of each of the rectangular triangles, in ascending order.ExampleInput:2
1
2Output:5
3
25
7
15
